oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Role of Liver Fluke in Infertility of Beef Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Foreyt, W. J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fascioliasis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study was initiated to determine the effect of liver flukes on the reproductive performance of beef cattle. Results are based on field studies with naturally infected cattle in Texas and Idaho and a study with experimentally infected cattle. Attention was called to the problem because poor reproduction was a consistent finding in selected herds with liver fluke infections.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1981; 99-103
